TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit RoutedPropertyChangedEventArgs`1<T> extends System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs

Docs.typeparam: The type of the dependency property that has changed.
Docs.summary: Provides data about a change in value to a dependency property as reported by particular routed events, including the previous and current value of the property that changed.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This is a generic class where the class is used for event data of different events. Different routed events can specify the type constraint of the generic to produce a type-specific event data class. Once the class is constrained, the <xref:System.Windows.RoutedPropertyChangedEventArgs%601.OldValue%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.RoutedPropertyChangedEventArgs%601.NewValue%2A> properties also reflect these type constraints; thus you can use a common event data class for different property changed events without requiring different delegates for each possible property type.
Routed events that reports a property change where the delegate incorporates this event data class include <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.ValueChanged>, where the type constraint (and old and new values passed in the arguments) is of type <xref:System.Double>, and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.TreeView.SelectedItemChanged>, where the type constraint is <xref:System.Object>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(!T oldValue, !T newValue) cil managed

Docs.param: Previous value of the property, prior to the event being raised.
Current value of the property at the time of the event.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, with provided old and new values.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The types passed must match the declared constraints of the specific generic.

MemberSignature.Value: public RoutedPropertyChangedEventArgs (T oldValue, T newValue, System.Windows.RoutedEvent routedEvent);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(!T oldValue, !T newValue, class System.Windows.RoutedEvent routedEvent) cil managed

Docs.param: Previous value of the property, prior to the event being raised.
Current value of the property at the time of the event.
Identifier of the routed event that this arguments class carries information for.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, with provided old and new values, and an event identifier.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The types passed for `oldValue` and `newValue` must match the declared constraints of the specific generic.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override void InvokeEventHandler (Delegate genericHandler, object genericTarget);
.method familyhidebysig virtual instance void InvokeEventHandler(class System.Delegate genericHandler, object genericTarget) cil managed

Docs.param: The generic handler to call in a type-specific way.
The target to call the handler on.
Docs.summary: Invokes event handlers in a type-specific way, which can increase event system efficiency.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This implementation casts the generic handler as a <xref:System.Windows.RoutedPropertyChangedEventHandler%601> and then invokes it. For details on this implementation pattern and the reasons for it, see <xref:System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.InvokeEventHandler%2A> and [Routed Events Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/routed-events-overview.md).

Docs.summary: Gets the new value of a property as reported by a property changed event.
Docs.value: The generic value. In a practical implementation of the , the generic type of this property is replaced with the constrained type of the implementation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value and type constraint of this property will be established by the constructor.

Docs.summary: Gets the previous value of the property as reported by a property changed event.
Docs.value: The generic value. In a practical implementation of the , the generic type of this property is replaced with the constrained type of the implementation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value and type constraint of this property will be established by the <xref:System.Windows.RoutedPropertyChangedEventArgs%601> constructor's type arguments.
